Getting Started   Academic Policies & Procedures   Advisement   Calendars   Student Engagement & Groups   Student Directory   Student Journey               Request More Information    Apply to Wagner                                       Skills and Prep Workshops and Modules   Wagner offers a variety of skills and prep workshops and modules to help students succeed in their coursework and professional development.  These optional, non-credit offerings are available to new and continuing students and cover a range of helpful topics from library research methods and presentation skills to math skills review and SPSS proficiency.  Workshops tend to meet for a single session; modules tend to meet for multiple sessions over a period of days or weeks.  Most workshops are covered by the academic support fee; modules require an additional $175 module fee.   Workshops:   NONCR-GP 102 Library Research Methods   NONCR-GP 103 Presentation Skills   NONCR-GP 104 Citation Methods   NONCR-GP 106 Time/Project Management   NONCR-GP 108 Composing Your Career   NONCR-GP 160 Urban Planning Skills (MUP only; required)   Modules:   NONCR-GP 906 Math Review Session   NONCR-GP 907 Professional Writing   NONCR-GP 909 Debt Structuring Module   NONCR-GP 931 SPSS Computer Module   NONCR-GP 932 Excel Computer Module   NONCR-GP 933 Excel Computer Module II   NONCR-GP 934 Introduction to Access   NONCR-GP 989 Introduction to Governance   Students can register for these workshops and modules on Albert just as they would any credit-bearing course.  Dates, times, and Albert Class Numbers may be found in the Albert Course Search under the subject area prefix “NONCR-GP.”                                                                                    © NYU Wagner   295 Lafayette Street, New York, NY 10012-9604   212.998.7400   Copyright and Fair Use   Contact Us   Sitemap   New York University

Excel Module II | NYU Wagner                                    Jump to navigation                                                             Excel Module II   NONCR-GP.933, points.       Courses         Description |    Syllabi |    Evaluations           This workshop introduces students to Excel’s advanced tools for data analysis and modeling. Topics include shortcut keys, sorting and filtering, conditional formatting, macros, a variety of formulas (if, lookup, index, match, etc.), array formulas, graphing, pivot tables and charts, what-if analysis (scenario manager, goal seek, and data tables), and regression analysis.    Prerequisites: CORE-GP.1021 or concurrently                     Semester     Instructor     Syllabus Link         Spring 2011  Syllabus  Spring 2013  Syllabus  Fall 2012  Syllabus  Spring 2012  Syllabus  Fall 2011  Syllabus                         Semester     Instructor     Evaluation Link         Spring 2014 Justin Walter Evaluation  Fall 2012 Rose, S. Evaluation  Fall 2013 Justin Walter Evaluation  Spring 2013 Shanna Rose Evaluation  Spring 2012 Rose, Shanna Evaluation  Spring 2011 Rose, Shanna Evaluation  Fall 2010 Bennett, Paul Evaluation                             Course Section Fall2015001 Spring2015001                         Instructors:        Upholt, Gretchen M                             Weekly Schedule:        Sat - 9:30 am to 11:30 am Sat - 9:30 am to 11:30 am                     Session Dates:        09/19/2015 to 09/19/2015  10/03/2015 to 10/10/2015                                  Location:         Bldg:194M Room:304                                      Instructors:        Upholt, Gretchen M                             Weekly Schedule:        Sat - 9:00 am to 11:00 am Sat - 9:00 am to 11:00 am Sat - 9:00 am to 11:00 am                     Session Dates:        02/14/2015 to 02/14/2015  02/28/2015 to 02/28/2015  03/07/2015 to 03/07/2015                                  Location:         Bldg:WAVE Room:668
